definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: Fathers do not embitter your children, or they will become discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 你们做父亲的，不要惹儿女的气，恐怕他们失了志气。

sentences.english: His  spirit was vitiated by pleasure seeking.
sentences.chinese: 他的志气因追求吃喝玩乐而消磨殆尽。
但是我们的志气可不小。

sentences.english: As long as you have the determination and perseverance, no matter what happened can do a good job.
sentences.chinese: 只要你有志气，有毅力，无论什么事都能做好。

sentences.english: Antonio Cassano says he's found some like-minded characters in the AC Milan locker room.
sentences.chinese: 卡萨诺在米兰更衣室内找到了些志气相投地分子。

sentences.english: Husband ambition thin, children learned that Ann?
sentences.chinese: 丈夫志气薄，儿女安得知？

sentences.english: Fathers, provoke not your children [to anger], lest they be discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 你们作父亲的，不要惹儿女的气，恐怕他们失去志气。

sentences.english: Meaning of this statement is that there are goal-oriented , people will eventually be successful.
sentences.chinese: 这句话的意思是，有志气的人终究会成功。

sentences.english: Belong to you , the good child with an ambition outstandingly .
sentences.chinese: 优秀属于你，有志气的好孩子。

sentences.english: “We are poor, but we are good, ” she said.
sentences.chinese: “我们很穷，但是我们还有志气在，”她说。

sentences.english: A man of character does not rail at his fate.
sentences.chinese: 一个有志气的人是不会抱怨命运的。

sentences.english: Everything is going smoothly. luck, have a bright future. by ambition.
sentences.chinese: 一帆风顺靠运气，鹏程万里靠志气。

sentences.english: I am a person who is ambitious and loves to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 可以说我是个有志气和喜欢笑的男生。

sentences.english: Our Party has always been adhering to this tradition.
sentences.chinese: 我们党历来是有理想，有志气，不怕“鬼”的。

sentences.english: Of course not, it's infuriating! Why wasn't he this ambitious while with me?
sentences.chinese: 真是气死人了，为何他跟我在一起时没这么有志气？

sentences.english: No proud leader in this room wants to ask for aid.
sentences.chinese: 在座任何一位有志气的领导人都不希望要求得到援助。

definition: to yield interest, profit etc/to exhale (Buddhism)
